answers.answer:
People fleeing the war in Ukraine through the Romanian social health insurance system are entitled to the basic service package, which includes medical assistance, medicines, medical devices, and services under national curative health programs, similar to Romanian insured persons. This encompasses curative, preventive, and prophylactic services, as well as specialized ambulatory medical assistance without needing a referral ticket for those in special situations.

To find detailed information, you can visit the website `https://dopomoha.ro/en/family-doctor-for-refugees-from-ukraine` and read under sections such as "The basic service package," "Family doctor," "Curative medical services," and "Preventive Services."
answers.bResponse:
People fleeing the war in Ukraine through the Romanian social health insurance system are entitled to the basic service package, which includes medical assistance, medicines, medical devices, and services under national curative health programs, similar to Romanian insured persons. This encompasses curative, preventive, and prophylactic services, as well as specialized ambulatory medical assistance without needing a referral ticket for those in special situations.

To find detailed information, you can visit the website `https://dopomoha.ro/en/family-doctor-for-refugees-from-ukraine` and read under sections such as "The basic service package," "Family doctor," "Curative medical services," and "Preventive Services." For more details, visit https://dopomoha.ro/en/family-doctor-for-refugees-from-ukraine

answers.answer:
Individuals from Ukraine in special situations are not required to pay social health insurance contributions, personal contributions for outpatient medicines, or co-payments for medical services in Romania.

To find this detailed information, go to the website https://dopomoha.ro/en/family-doctor-for-refugees-from-ukraine and read under the section titled "The rights granted by the Romanian social health insurance system to people fleeing the war in Ukraine."

To find this detailed information, go to the website https://dopomoha.ro/en/family-doctor-for-refugees-from-ukraine and read under the section titled "The rights granted by the Romanian social health insurance system to people fleeing the war in Ukraine." For more details, visit https://dopomoha.ro/en/family-doctor-for-refugees-from-ukraine

answers.answer:
People coming from the armed conflict area in Ukraine are registered by medical service providers in an IT application made available by the National Health Insurance House when they request medical services for the first time, which assigns them an identification number. The printed data from this registration is then given to the beneficiary and can be used at any medical unit in Romania.

You can find detailed information on the dopomoha.ro website, under the section "Registration in the social health insurance system for people coming from the armed conflict area in Ukraine" on the page titled "Family doctor for refugees from Ukraine".
answers.bResponse:

The printed data from this registration is then given to the beneficiary and can be used at any medical unit in Romania.

You can find detailed information on the dopomoha.ro website, under the section "Registration in the social health insurance system for people coming from the armed conflict area in Ukraine" on the page titled "Family doctor for refugees from Ukraine". For more details, visit https://dopomoha.ro/en/family-doctor-for-refugees-from-ukraine

answers.answer:
The basic service package in the Romanian social health insurance system covers curative, preventive, and prophylactic medical services, including home care, medication administration, and diagnostic and therapeutic services like spirometry, ECG, and minor surgical procedures. It also includes medicines and medical devices, such as recommendations for prosthetic devices for stomas and urinary incontinence.

To find more detailed information, go to the website https://dopomoha.ro/en/family-doctor-for-refugees-from-ukraine and read under the section "The basic service package" and its sub-sections, particularly "Family doctor."

A family doctor in Romania serves as the primary point of contact for Ukrainian refugees, offering a comprehensive basic medical services package that includes curative, preventive, and diagnostic services, as well as medication administration and home/remote consultations, without requiring prior registration on their patient list.

To find detailed information, visit the website dopomoha.ro/en/family-doctor-for-refugees-from-ukraine and read under the sections "Family doctor" and "The basic service package".

answers.answer:
No, people from Ukraine do not need to be registered on a family doctor's own list to receive medical services in Romania; family doctors provide services without requiring registration on their own list.

You can find this information on the website https://dopomoha.ro/en/family-doctor-for-refugees-from-ukraine under the section titled "Family doctor". Look for the paragraph that describes services for people coming from the armed conflict zone in Ukraine.

answers.answer:
A family doctor in Romania can provide curative medical services for emergencies and acute conditions, including minor surgery or specific maneuvers. These services also encompass a range of diagnostic and therapeutic procedures such as wound treatment, foreign body extraction, various injections, infusions, and diagnostic tests like spirometry or electrocardiograms.

To find more detailed information, visit the website dopomoha.ro/en/family-doctor-for-refugees-from-ukraine and read under the section 'Fields of medical assistance', specifically the subsections 'Family doctor' and 'The basic package in primary medical care includes:'.

answers.answer:
Patients with chronic diseases can receive one consultation per month from a family doctor, either in the office or remotely.

You can find this information on the website dopomoha.ro/en/family-doctor-for-refugees-from-ukraine under the 'Family doctor' section, specifically within the subsection 'Patients with chronic diseases'.

answers.answer:
Family doctors in Romania offer preventive health services for all age groups, including regular check-ups tailored to specific age brackets (e.g., frequent for 0-3 years, annual for 4-18, less frequent for adults), and an annual prevention package for those 40+ covering various health risks. They also provide diabetes detection for asymptomatic adults aged 18 and over with risk factors.

To find this detailed information, go to the website `https://dopomoha.ro/en/family-doctor-for-refugees-from-ukraine` and read under the section titled "Preventive Services".
